tutorial/tutorial_swipe_002:
You can explore the Pokémon Center
by swiping left or right on the screen.

There are always a handful of
Trainers around the lobby to talk to
and get to know better!
tutorial/tutorial_taptalk_002:
Feel like striking up a conversation?
Try tapping the Trainers with a small
icon above their head to have a chat!

Who knows? They might challenge
you to a Pokémon battle or even
give you some useful items!
tutorial/tutorial_fieldgo_002:
If you’d like to continue to the
next area, tap the blue arrow near
the bottom of the screen.
tutorial/tutorial_common_101:
Now it’s your turn.
Good luck!
tutorial/tutorial_waza_100:
Typical battles on Pasio are fought in
teams of 3-on-3, and you control
each of your three teammates!
tutorial/tutorial_waza_101:
First, try attacking with
Pikachu’s Thunder Shock!
tutorial/tutorial_waza_111:
Using moves depletes
your move gauge!
tutorial/tutorial_waza_112: Your move gauge fills up over time!
tutorial/tutorial_waza_121:
Tap on Brock’s window to
use one of Onix’s moves!
tutorial/tutorial_ctarget_101:
Every sync pair has a type that
it’s weak against.
tutorial/tutorial_ctarget_111:
Attack with moves that match
its weakness type to inflict
double the damage!
tutorial/tutorial_ctarget_121:
Try switching targets to a Pokémon
that’s weak against your attacks!
tutorial/tutorial_ctarget_211:
Tap a Pokémon on the
opposite team to target it!
tutorial/tutorial_ctarget_221:
The border around this window will
flash if you have a move that’s
super effective against the target!
tutorial/tutorial_ctarget_241:
Next, try using Brock’s Onix to target
one of your opponents’ weaknesses!
tutorial/tutorial_ctarget_251:
Switch between your
teammates to use the
most effective moves!
tutorial/tutorial_buddies_111:
Sync moves are powerful attacks
capable of doing massive damage
to your opponents.
tutorial/tutorial_buddies_138:
Every time you use a
move, your sync move
countdown goes down.
tutorial/tutorial_buddies_141:
That goes for all three
teammates! Every move
reduces the countdown!
tutorial/tutorial_buddies_151:
Countdown complete!
Tap the icon to unleash
a powerful sync move!
tutorial/tutorial_buddies_211: Select which sync pair you’d like to use!
tutorial/tutorial_passive_101:
Some opponents have special
passive skills!
tutorial/tutorial_passive_111:
This sync pair has a passive skill
called Clearheaded—it prevents the
Pokémon from becoming confused!
tutorial/tutorial_change_101:
Let’s learn a little about multiteam
battling before we jump into co-op
with other players!
tutorial/tutorial_change_111:
The Pokémon you see on Pikachu’s
left and right belong to the other
players’ teams.
tutorial/tutorial_change_121:
Your team is always in the center
position. The active sync pair here
is the only one you control.
tutorial/tutorial_change_131:
The sync pair you place in your
team’s #1 position will always be
the first on the field.
tutorial/tutorial_change_141:
The left and right windows are the
other two sync pairs on your team.
Right now, they’re on standby.
tutorial/tutorial_change_151:
During a battle, you may need to
switch your active sync pair with
one that’s on standby!
tutorial/tutorial_change_172:
You can tap Onix to switch him in
or tap one of his moves to use it
right away once he’s on the field.
tutorial/tutorial_change_173:
Tap this move to switch in
and use it immediately!
tutorial/tutorial_change_201: Try attacking with your active sync pair!
tutorial/tutorial_issei_101:
Let’s try syncing up with the other
players for a unity attack!
tutorial/tutorial_issei_111:
To use a unity attack, you need to 
fill up your unity gauge.
tutorial/tutorial_issei_131:
Fill up your unity gauge by building
up a continuous chain of attacks
with your allies!
tutorial/tutorial_issei_141:
Success! You and your allies built up
a chain of continuous attacks without
being interrupted by the other team!
tutorial/tutorial_issei_151:
The more chains you create,
the faster your unity gauge fills up!
tutorial/tutorial_issei_161:
Try building up a
chain of attacks!
tutorial/tutorial_issei_171:
Creating a chain with all three allies
activates a unity bonus! While in
effect, your attack power increases!
tutorial/tutorial_issei_173:
On top of that, EVERY attack fills up
your unity gauge, whether or not
you create another chain!
tutorial/tutorial_issei_181:
Make sure you use as many attacks
as possible before the effects of
your unity bonus wear off!
tutorial/tutorial_issei_191:
Continue attacking while
unity bonus is in effect!
tutorial/tutorial_issei_211:
You filled your unity gauge to max!
Get ready to unleash a powerful
unity attack with your allies!
tutorial/tutorial_issei_221:
Choose which sync pair to
use for the attack before
the timer runs out!
tutorial/tutorial_cattack_111:
Tap the sync pair you wish
to switch out!
tutorial/tutorial_cattack_121:
You can tap on a move
to use it immediately
after switching in!
tutorial/tutorial_deaigashira_101:
The move First Impression will fail
unless it’s the first move used upon
entering the battlefield. This attack
does massive damage!
tutorial/tutorial_speed_101:
Tap here to speed up
the pace of the battle!
tutorial/tutorial_speed_111:
Your speed and auto
settings will carry over
to the next battle!
tutorial/tutorial_bdwaza_101:
Max moves are incredibly powerful
and can be used at any time!
tutorial/tutorial_bdwaza_111:
However, each sync pair can use
their set of max moves only once
per battle. Give it a try!
tutorial/B_literacy02_101:
Have your teammates keep using
as many moves as possible!
tutorial/B_literacy02_111:
Each time your team uses a move, it
lowers your sync move countdown,
which helps you use sync
moves faster!
tutorial/B_literacy02_112:
This time, try having the sync pair on
your team that deals the most
damage attack with a sync move
before your opponent can!
tutorial/B_literacy02_121:
When you use a sync move, it raises
your team’s sync buff by one rank!
tutorial/B_literacy02_131:
With your sync buff at rank one,
damage you deal to your opponents
is multiplied by 1.5!
tutorial/B_literacy02_141:
If you use another sync move and
raise your sync buff to rank two,
the damage you deal is doubled!
tutorial/B_literacy02_142:
Your sync buff rank will increase
each time you use a sync move,
as will the amount of damage
you deal!
tutorial/B_literacy02_151:
Using your team’s moves
continuously to quickly raise your
sync buff rank is the key to victory!
tutorial/B_literacy03_101:
There are two types of moves that
can deal damage to your opponent:
physical attack moves and special
attack moves.
tutorial/B_literacy03_111:
This icon represents physical attack
moves! The higher your sync pair’s
Attack, the harder these attacks
can hit.
tutorial/B_literacy03_121:
This icon is for special attack moves!
These are powered up by your
sync pair’s Sp. Atk!
tutorial/B_literacy03_131:
You can use X Sp. Atk to
significantly raise your Sp. Atk!
tutorial/B_literacy03_141:
Try to raise your Sp. Atk as much as
possible, then attack with a move
that deals even more damage!
tutorial/B_literacy04_101:
Check whether your opponent is
using physical attack moves or
special attack moves!
tutorial/B_literacy04_111:
You can tell what type of move
your opponent is using by looking at
the icons shown when they attack!
tutorial/B_literacy04_121:
The red icon is for physical
attack moves!
tutorial/B_literacy04_131:
The blue icon is for special
attack moves!
tutorial/B_literacy04_141:
If your opponent is using physical
attack moves, you can reduce the
damage dealt by raising your
Defense with X Defense All +!
tutorial/B_literacy04_151:
If your opponent is using special
attack moves, you can reduce
damage by raising your Sp. Def with
X Sp. Def All +!
tutorial/B_literacy04_161:
Stats can be raised up to six stat
ranks! Try to have all sync pairs on
your team raise your stats as much
as possible with their moves!
tutorial/B_literacy05_101:
That’s all for now! You won’t be
beating me with attacks like that!
tutorial/B_literacy05B_101:
When you land a critical hit, your
opponent’s stat increases are
ignored and your attack does 1.5
times the damage it usually deals!
tutorial/B_literacy05B_111:
Try using moves that can raise your
critical-hit rate so that you can land
more critical hits!
tutorial/B_literacy05B_121:
Unlike other stats, your critical-hit
rate can only be raised up to three
stat ranks!
tutorial/B_literacy05B_131:
If you raise your critical-hit rate by
three ranks, your moves will always
be critical hits, so raise your
critical-hit rate as much as you can!
tutorial/B_literacy05B_141:
You can tell how much your
critical-hit rate has been raised by
checking this icon!
tutorial/B_literacy06_101:
Sync pairs are equipped with a
variety of different passive skills.
tutorial/B_literacy06_111:
Passive skills are handy techniques
that activate during battle.
tutorial/B_literacy06_121:
In this battle, Delphox has a passive
skill called Psychic Power 9!
tutorial/B_literacy06_131:
Psychic Power 9 is a passive skill
that makes Psychic-type moves a
lot more powerful!
tutorial/B_literacy06_141:
Try battling while using moves that
make use of this passive skill!
tutorial/B_literacy07_101:
Use everything you’ve learned on
Victory Road in this next battle!
tutorial/tutorial_wazatokkun_001_10:
Let’s try learning a new move!
Go to the Team menu and select
Moves & Skills.
tutorial/tutorial_wazatokkun_002_10:
First, confirm that you have the
required items here.
tutorial/tutorial_wazatokkun_003_10:
Once a move is learned, it’s ready to
be used in battle! Try learning some
moves with your favorite sync pairs!
tutorial/tutorial_shopgacha_001_11:
At the shop, you can scout for new
teammates, exchange your items,
and acquire all sorts of useful things!
tutorial/tutorial_shopgacha_001_12:
First, let’s use Sync Pair Scout to
reach out to some new teammates!
tutorial/tutorial_shopgacha_002_11:
You found a new teammate!
Scout again to reach out to more
Trainers and build your dream team!
tutorial/tutorial_shopgacha_003_11:
Collect your bonus level-up manual
by visiting your Present Box!
tutorial/tutorial_shopscout_001_11:
At the shop, you can scout for new
teammates, exchange your items,
and acquire all sorts of useful things!
tutorial/tutorial_shopscout_001_12:
First, let’s use Sync Pair Scout to
reach out to some new teammates!
tutorial/tutorial_shopscout_002_11:
You found a new teammate!
Scout again to reach out to more
Trainers and build your dream team!
tutorial/tutorial_shopscout_003_11:
Collect your bonus level-up manual
by visiting your Present Box!
tutorial/tutorial_itemexchange_001_10:
Use this screen to exchange your
coins and items for various things
you might need.
tutorial/tutorial_levelup_001_11:
You can use level-up manuals
to help your sync pairs gain
experience and level up!
tutorial/tutorial_charaepisode_001_11:
Choose a sync pair story to go on
an adventure and get to know
your fellow teammates!
tutorial/tutorial_multi_001_11:
Tap this button to edit your teams
for co-op battling.
tutorial/tutorial_storyclear_001_11:
Currently, this is as far as the
story goes.
tutorial/tutorial_storyclear_001_12:
Please look forward to further updates
in the near future!
tutorial/tutorial_storyclear_001_15:
Congratulations, PML champion!
Keep on battling to prepare yourself 
for future challenges!
tutorial/tutorial_storyclear_001_19:
Congratulations on completing 
Challenge Giovanni: Part 2! You can
now look forward to more villain
arc story content that will arrive in
late September.* 

*Current plan as of the start of
this event
tutorial/tutorial_storyclear_001_17:
[Name:QuestGroupTitle ] complete!
Keep on battling to prepare yourself 
for future challenges!
tutorial/tutorial_storyclear_002_11:
You’ve completed all the story content
that is currently available here.
We hope you look forward to
future updates.
tutorial/tutorial_storyclear_001_21:
You’ve completed this story! You can
now look forward to more villain arc
story content that will arrive in
mid-January!*

*Current plan as of the start of
this event
tutorial/tutorial_storyclear_001_22:
Congratulations on completing Battle
Challenge! Round 2! You can now look
forward to the continuation of the
Sinnoh chapter that will arrive in
early February.*

*Current plan as of the start of
this event
tutorial/tutorial_storyhard_001_11:
Pokémon Masters League
hard mode unlocked!
tutorial/tutorial_storyhard_001_12:
You now have access to area info
with even more challenging battles!
tutorial/tutorial_storyveryhard_001_11:
Pokémon Masters League
very hard mode unlocked!
tutorial/tutorial_storyveryhard_001_12:
You now have access to area info
with even more challenging battles!
tutorial/tutorial_multihard_001_11:
You now have access to
EX Challenges in the EX Plaza!
tutorial/tutorial_favoritebaddies_001_11:
You can choose a favorite
sync pair to appear with you
on your profile screen.
tutorial/tutorial_hoshiup_001_11:
You can use ★ Power-Ups to
increase a sync pair’s number of ★s
and help them grow stronger!
tutorial/tutorial_event_mission_001_11:
You now have access to the
events area! Let’s check out what
events are going on right now!
tutorial/tutorial_event_mission_001_12:
Ongoing events will appear in the
Events category. Check often to
avoid missing special limited-time
area info!
tutorial/tutorial_extraarea_001_12:
Visit the EX Plaza to collect items
that will help you learn moves and
passive skills, level up, and more!
tutorial/tutorial_extraarea_001_13:
When you receive area info for
learning new battle techniques,
that will appear here as well.
tutorial/tutorial_genkaitoppa_001_11:
You now have access to the
Unlock Level Cap menu!
tutorial/tutorial_genkaitoppa_001_21:
Unlocking a sync pair’s level cap
means that they can raise their level
even higher and grow even stronger!
tutorial/tutorial_jyogenkaihou1_002_11:
Visit the EX Plaza to collect the
special items required for unlocking
the level caps on your sync pairs!
tutorial/tutorial_jyogenkaihou1_004_11:
You can access this area info in the
Special Training: Battle Techniques
sub-section of the EX Plaza!
tutorial/tutorial_jyogenkaihou1_004_12:
Complete this area to make
sync pair level caps unlockable!
tutorial/tutorial_jyogenkaihou1_005_10:
Let’s try unlocking our current
level cap with some Buff Blend.
Go to the Team menu and select
Unlock Level Cap.
tutorial/tutorial_jyogenkaihou1_006_10:
First, confirm that you have the
required items here.
tutorial/tutorial_jyogenkaihou1_007_10:
Nice! The max level you can achieve
is now even higher.
Next, try unlocking the level caps of
your other favorite sync pairs.
tutorial/tutorial_kasane_001_11:
When you scout out a sync pair that
you already have, their sync move
levels up!
tutorial/tutorial_kasane_001_21:
Once a sync move reaches its level 5
max, you’ll receive a ★ Power-Up
with the same number of ★s as the
duplicate sync pair instead!
tutorial/tutorial_hensei_001_10:
Let’s try editing your team with the
new sync pair you just scouted!
tutorial/tutorial_hensei_001_11:
First, select the sync pair you wish
to switch out.
tutorial/tutorial_hensei_001_12:
Next, select the sync pair you wish
to switch in!
tutorial/tutorial_hensei_001_13:
The sync pair you selected is now
a part of your team!
tutorial/tutorial_hensei_001_14:
Give yourself an advantage by
editing your team based on the
type of battling you’ll be doing next!
tutorial/tutorial_shinka_001_11:
For some sync pairs, leveling up can
unlock special area info for evolving
Pokémon! However, Evolution shards
and Evolution crystals are required.
tutorial/tutorial_shinka_001_21:
Complete this special sync pair story
to evolve your Pokémon and make
this sync pair even stronger!
tutorial/tutorial_osusumetype_001_11:
Rosa’s Pokémon uses Grass-type
moves, so having her on your team
will give you an advantage!
tutorial/tutorial_osusumetype_001_12:
Tap this button to edit your team
now, or go to the Team menu to
edit your team later!
tutorial/tutorial_osusumetype_002_11:
Barry’s Pokémon uses Water-type
moves, so having him on your team
will give you an advantage!
tutorial/tutorial_osusumetype_003_11:
Flannery’s Pokémon uses Fire-type
moves, so having her on your team
will give you an advantage!
tutorial/tutorial_multiplay_001_12:
You now have access to co-op
battles where you can fight
alongside other players!
tutorial/tutorial_multiplay_001_13: Let’s give co-op battling a try now!
tutorial/tutorial_multiplay_001_14:
During this tutorial, you’ll be battling
alongside NPCs for practice!
tutorial/tutorial_multiplay_001_15:
Try syncing up with your allies
to create attack chains and
unleash a unity attack!
tutorial/tutorial_multiplay_001_16:
Now you’re ready for some
multiteam battling!
tutorial/tutorial_multiplay_001_17:
Choose an area to explore under
the Co-op tab to join other players
in multiteam battles!
tutorial/tutorial_multiplay_001_18:
To continue the main story, choose
an area to explore under the
Single-Player tab.
tutorial/tutorial_event_mission_001_22:
You now have access to the Missions
menu on your Poryphone.
Don’t forget to claim your rewards
whenever you complete a mission!
tutorial/tutorial_tansaku_001_11:
You unlocked a new kind of area
where you can explore Pasio and
mingle with other Pokémon Trainers.
tutorial/tutorial_tansaku_001_12:
These special areas won’t affect your
progression in the main story, so
you can explore whenever you like!
tutorial/tutorial_soubi_001_11: Your team can now use gear!
tutorial/tutorial_soubi_001_12:
You can equip your team with gear
to make them even stronger!
tutorial/tutorial_soubi_003_10:
Let’s try equipping a
1★ Electric Bracelet.
Go to the Team menu,
and select Edit Team.
tutorial/tutorial_soubi_004_10:
You equipped a 1★ Electric Bracelet!
Next, try equipping your teams with
some other awesome gear.
tutorial/tutorial_soubi_005_10:
Equipping gear is especially effective
when the gear’s type matches your
sync pairs’ types.
tutorial/tutorial_soubi_006_11:
In the Upgrade Gear section of the
Team menu, you can use duplicate
gear along with special items to
make your gear even better.
tutorial/tutorial_soubi_006_12:
Completing co-op battles on
Very Hard is a good way to collect
gear and gear-related items.
tutorial/tutorial_soubi_006_13:
Completing co-op battles in the main
story and EX Plaza is a good way to
collect gear and other items.
tutorial/tutorial_soubi_007_11:
Unwanted gear can be exchanged
for coins using the Exchange Gear
section of the shop.
tutorial/tutorial_soubi_007_12:
Unwanted gear can be exchanged
for coins and gear-related items
using the Exchange Gear section of
the shop.
tutorial/tutorial_soubi_levelup_001_11:
You can use various items to
upgrade and enhance your gear!
tutorial/tutorial_soubi_levelup_001_12:
Any duplicate gear you obtain can
be used to unlock level caps and
upgrade your gear even further!
tutorial/tutorial_soubi_sale_001_10:
Use this screen to get rid of gear
you no longer need and exchange
it for coins.
tutorial/tutorial_soubi_sale_001_11:
Use this screen to get rid of gear
you no longer need and exchange
it for coins and gear-related items.
tutorial/tutorial_soubi_sale_001_12:
More gear-related items can be
received based on the current level
and maximum level of the
exchanged gear.
tutorial/tutorial_koutaiattack_001_11:
Use this area info to participate in
Special Training: Battle Techniques
over in the EX Plaza!
tutorial/tutorial_koutaiattack_002_11:
Switch-in moves unlocked!
In co-op battles, you can now tap
a standby sync pair’s move to have
them switch in and use it right away.
tutorial/tutorial_shinka_002_11:
In order to participate in sync pair
stories about Pokémon Evolution,
you’ll need some Evolution materials.
tutorial/tutorial_shinka_002_21:
You can exchange certain items for
Evolution materials in the shop!
tutorial/tutorial_iwakudaki_001_11:
When you need to smash rocks
in the field, Brock and Onix can
lend you their strength. If a rock
looks smashable, tap it and see
what happens!
tutorial/tutorial_hidenwaza_001_10:
This rock looks breakable! Do you want
Brock and Onix to smash it?
tutorial/tutorial_shinka_003_11:
After reaching a certain level, some
sync pairs unlock special Evolution
area info! To visit these areas, you’ll
need to collect either Evolution shards
or Evolution crystals.
tutorial/tutorial_denpoke_001_11:
Complete event areas to collect
Custom Vouchers!
tutorial/tutorial_denpoke_001_12:
Custom Voucher 1:

Collect a total of 800 of these to
unlock special area info and team up
with Giovanni & Mewtwo!
tutorial/tutorial_denpoke_001_13:
In the Exchange Items menu, you can
exchange Custom Vouchers for
other custom items that will make
Giovanni & Mewtwo even stronger!
tutorial/tutorial_event_news001_01:
Tap here to learn more about
the event.
tutorial/tutorial_storyclear_001_13:
Currently, this is as far as the story
goes. Try tapping the Co-op tab on
the Explore menu to challenge Trainers
from the main story along with friends
and other players!
tutorial/tutorial_villa_text_001_01:
You now have access to the
Battle Villa! See how far you and
your roster of sync pairs can go
before the time runs out in this
all-new, endurance-based challenge!
tutorial/tutorial_villa_text_001_02:
Open the Explore menu to check it
out now!

To learn more about the Battle Villa,
tap the information button at the
top right of the screen.
tutorial/tutorial_villa_text_002_02:
Visit the Moves & Skills menu to
expand your sync pairs’ repertoire
with all-new lucky skills!
tutorial/tutorial_villa_text_002_03:
The lucky cookies and other special
items you’ll need to learn these skills
can be acquired in the Battle Villa.
tutorial/tutorial_villa_multi_text_001:
You now have access to co-op areas
in the Battle Villa!
Tap the Co-op tab to see the areas
you’ve unlocked so far.
tutorial/tutorial_villa_multi_text_002:
Once unlocked, these areas never
expire, so you can try your hand at
them anytime! Just be careful—
they aren’t easy!
tutorial/tutorial_villa_multi_text_003:
Battle hard! The more halls you
complete in the Battle Villa, the
more co-op areas you’ll unlock.
tutorial/tutorial_villa_clear_text_001:
You completed the final hall,
which means you can skip to a
hall of your choice on your next visit!
We eagerly await your return to
the Battle Villa!
tutorial/tutorial_villa_clear_text_002:
Until then, try your hand at a few
co-op battles to stock up on
lucky cookies.
tutorial/tutorial_villa_recovery_text_00:
Tap here to use Battle Villa
vitality treats.
tutorial/tutorial_villa_battleitem_text_:
Tap here to use Battle Villa
vigor treats.
tutorial/tutorial_denpoke_002_12:
Custom Voucher 2:
Collect a total of 100 of these to
unlock special area info and have the
chance to team up with Solgaleo.
tutorial/tutorial_denpoke_002_13:
In the Exchange Items menu, you can
exchange Custom Vouchers for other
custom items that will make your
Solgaleo sync pair even stronger.
tutorial/tutorial_denpoke_003_12:
Custom Voucher 3:
Collect a total of 100 of these to
unlock special area info and have
the chance to team up with
Zinnia & Rayquaza.
tutorial/tutorial_denpoke_003_13:
In the Exchange Items menu, you can
exchange Custom Vouchers for
other custom items that will make
Zinnia & Rayquaza even stronger.
tutorial/tutorial_okidomew_text_001_01:
Professor Oak & Mew can be
strengthened by using custom items.
tutorial/tutorial_okidomew_text_001_02:
You can obtain custom items by
completing Professor Oak & Mew
special missions!
tutorial/tutorial_okidomew_text_001_03:
Complete limited-time missions to
strengthen Professor Oak & Mew
before time runs out!
tutorial/tutorial_okidomew_text_001_04:
You must complete Chapter 4 of
the main story to participate in
event missions.
tutorial/tutorial_board_002_11:
You can now strengthen your favorite
sync pairs in a variety of new ways
using the sync grid. Collect sync orbs
to activate tiles and help your
teammates grow!
tutorial/tutorial_board_menu_001_11:
Use sync orbs to activate tiles and
strengthen your sync pairs in all sorts
of new ways!
tutorial/tutorial_board_menu_002_11:
Activating a tile on the sync grid
activates that grid skill for the 
corresponding sync pair.
tutorial/tutorial_board_menu_003_11:
Each tile requires a certain number
of unique sync orbs to be activated.
However, some tiles have additional
requirements that must be met.
tutorial/tutorial_board_menu_004_11:
To learn more, tap the information
button at the top right of the
sync grid screen.
tutorial/tutorial_event_bingo_mission_00:
Tap the bingo card icon to open
the Mission Bingo screen.
Don’t forget to claim your rewards
once you start filling up your card!
tutorial/tutorial_mainstory_001_10:
New difficulties have been added to
main story battle areas.
tutorial/tutorial_mainstory_001_11: You can choose your difficulty here.
tutorial/tutorial_new_epievent_001_11:
Use travel tokens to explore the map
and head toward the checkpoints!
tutorial/tutorial_solomulti_text_001:
Create your own lineup of three
teams to take on co-op battles solo!
tutorial/tutorial_solomulti_text_002:
Change your lineup by tapping the
Preset Teams or Edit buttons below
each team.
tutorial/tutorial_solomulti_text_003:
The same Trainer cannot be assigned
to more than one of your teams.
tutorial/tutorial_kasane_001_13:
Each time you acquire a sync pair
that is already on your team, that
sync pair’s moves will level up!
tutorial/tutorial_kasane_001_22:
Once their moves reach the level 5
max, you’ll receive a ★ power-up
with the same number of ★s as the
duplicate sync pair instead!
tutorial/tutorial_hoshiup_001_12:
Raising a sync pair’s move level
can power up their sync move,
their max moves, and their
standard move set.
tutorial/tutorial_jinkei_001:
Use the Tactics screen to choose the
order in which opponents will target
your team members.
tutorial/tutorial_jinkei_002:
Try placing a sync pair with high
HP, Defense, or Sp. Def first to
protect the rest of the team.
tutorial/tutorial_happiness_001:
Try giving goodies to the Pokémon
you hatch from Eggs!
tutorial/tutorial_denpoke_004_11:
Complete event areas to collect
prize coins!
tutorial/tutorial_denpoke_004_12:
You can use prize coins to pull from
the prize box and progress through
the event!
tutorial/tutorial_legend_text_001_01:
The Legendary Arena is open!

Assemble a strong team with a set
number of sync pairs, and battle
powerful Pokémon!
tutorial/tutorial_legend_text_001_02:
You can only take on one challenge
at a time in the Legendary Arena.

To reset your progress and start
a new challenge, go to the
Legendary Arena menu.
tutorial/tutorial_legend_text_001_03:
Caution: if a challenge you started
is inactive for more than one week,
it will be reset automatically.
tutorial/tutorial_specialreward_text_001:
You can earn special arena rewards
for battling in the Legendary Arena!

Tap the + button for more details
about arena rewards.

You can earn medals by completing
specific missions.

You can earn damage rewards when
the total damage dealt to the boss
Pokémon exceeds a set amount.
tutorial/tutorial_allmissionreward_text_:
You can earn special rewards for
completing every single mission in a
Legendary Arena challenge.

Tap the Mission Completion Rewards
button for more details.
tutorial/tutorial_legendready_text_001_0:
Each challenge in the
Legendary Arena has a unique
set of parameters.

These parameters can be found
in the Boss Hints section of the
Area Details screen.

Be sure to check them out before
heading into the battle!
tutorial/tutorial_souryokuready_text_001:
Assemble a strong team with a set
number of sync pairs and test your
skill in Full-Force Battles!

You can take on only one Full-Force
Battle at a time during each event.

If you’d like to take on a different
Full-Force Battle, tap the Reset
button on the main event menu.
tutorial/tutorial_labo_text_01:
Use this screen to place Eggs in
incubators and form sync pairs with
the Pokémon that hatch from them!
tutorial/tutorial_labo_text_02:
You can receive Eggs from Professor
Bellis after completing battles!
tutorial/tutorial_labo_text_03:
Place an Egg you receive from
Professor Bellis into an incubator at
Bellis’s lab.
tutorial/tutorial_labo_text_04:
Winning battles fills up the incubator’s
hatch gauge. Rack up the victories to
hatch your Eggs faster!
tutorial/tutorial_labo_text_05:
Once you’ve filled up the hatch
gauge, it’s only a matter of time
before the Egg hatches!
tutorial/tutorial_labo_text_06:
At the day care in Bellis’s lab,
you can form sync pairs with the
Pokémon you hatch from Eggs!
tutorial/tutorial_labo_text_07:
The Pokémon’s role and number of
passive skills can vary from Egg to
Egg, even among the same species!
tutorial/tutorial_labo_text_08:
You completed the tutorial!

To learn more, tap the information
button at the top right of the screen.
tutorial/tutorial_trainingarea_text_001_:
In the Training Area, you can collect
items used for leveling up sync pairs,
evolving Pokémon, and more!
tutorial/tutorial_eggevent_text_01:
Win battles to receive Eggs from
Professor Bellis!
tutorial/tutorial_eggevent_text_02:
Increase the Egg reward rate by
forming a team with sync pairs that
have supereffective sync moves!
tutorial/tutorial_eggevent_text_03:
If the player character is on the
team, the Egg reward rate is
increased further!
tutorial/tutorial_genkaitoppa_002_01:
You can use various items to
increase the maximum level
your sync pairs can achieve!
tutorial/tutorial_genkaitoppa_002_02:
To obtain these items, try taking on
battles in the Cap-Unlock Area of
the Training Area.
tutorial/tutorial_villa_text_002_02_02:
You can help your sync pairs unleash
their hidden powers by having them
learn lucky skills!
tutorial/tutorial_champion_battle_open:
With all of the PML badges in your
possession, you can now take on
the Champion Stadium!
tutorial/tutorial_champion_battle_normal:
Your first battles in the Champion
Stadium are against the Elite Four.

You can challenge the Champion
only after defeating the Elite Four.
tutorial/tutorial_champion_battle_hard_1:
Additional parameters are
added to battles starting from
Hard Lv. 1 difficulty.
tutorial/tutorial_champion_battle_hard_2:
Each of the four rounds against
the Elite Four has its own
special parameter.
tutorial/tutorial_champion_battle_hard_3:
Carefully consider the parameter for
each round before deciding the order
you’ll face each Elite Four member.
tutorial/tutorial_champion_battle_hard_4:
The Champion battle has its own set
special parameter—but that’s not all.
tutorial/tutorial_champion_battle_hard_5:
You must also choose a parameter
from your battles with the Elite Four
to apply to the Champion battle.
tutorial/tutorial_champion_battle_hard_6:
Once you win a battle, it can’t be
fought again until the following week.
tutorial/tutorial_champion_battle_hard_7:
The special parameters that are in
effect and the Pokémon used by your
opponents also change each week.
tutorial/tutorial_champion_battle_team_m:
Starting at Hard Lv. 1 difficulty,
sync pairs that have completed a
battle cannot take part in any other
Champion Stadium battles.

This restriction on eligible sync pairs
resets every week.
tutorial/tutorial_champion_battle_dendou:
Pieces of the medal are filled in for
each sync pair type you enter into
the Hall of Fame.

Try to fill in all the pieces and
complete your medal!
tutorial/tutorial_osusumetype_001_12_2:
Tap this button to edit your team
now, or go to the Sync Pairs menu
to edit your team later!
tutorial/tutorial_soubi_003_10_2:
Let’s try equipping a 1★ Electric
Bracelet. Go to the Sync Pairs menu
and select Edit Team.
tutorial/tutorial_soubi_006_11_2:
In the Upgrade Gear section of the
Sync Pairs menu, you can use
duplicate gear along with special
items to make your gear even better.
tutorial/tutorial_specialbonus_text_001_:
Special bonuses apply to certain
sync pairs in this event. Take a look
at the bonuses here.

Be sure to check the details here for
events that feature special bonuses.
tutorial/tutorial_switcheggbuddy_text_01:
The new Switch View button allows
you to switch between viewing
regular sync pairs and those formed
with Pokémon hatched from Eggs.
tutorial/tutorial_villa_text_001_02_b:
The Battle Villa can be accessed from
the Explore menu. Please note that it
is only available for a limited time
each month.
tutorial/tutorial_villa2_text_001_01:
The Battle Villa is a special area
where the status of sync pairs, such
as remaining HP, is carried over from
battle to battle and some restrictions
are applied to team composition.
tutorial/tutorial_villa2_text_001_02:
Your team’s HP and MP (Move Points)
are carried over from battle to battle.
Your opponents’ HP and the number
of opponents defeated are carried
over as well.
tutorial/tutorial_villa2_text_001_03:
Sync pairs that have fallen to 0 HP
will be unable to participate in
battles again until a full recovery is
administered. One full recovery is
provided per day.
tutorial/tutorial_villa2_text_001_04:
For more information, tap the button
in the top right corner of the Battle
Villa menu. Gather your sync pairs,
and try your best to complete the
final hall before the challenge ends!
tutorial/tutorial_forced_potential_text_: Teach lucky skills to your sync pairs.

Choose the sync pair that will learn
a lucky skill.

First, use lucky scrolls to unlock the
sync pair’s lucky skill slot.
You successfully learned a lucky skill.

A random lucky skill is learned when
you use a lucky cookie.

You can overwrite lucky skills by
using additional lucky cookies. Try
using lucky cookies until you get the
skill you want!

More information on lucky skills can
be found in Tips.
tutorial/tutorial_okidomew_text_002_02:
Complete Chapter 2: A Friendly New
Rival, and go get this sync pair on
your team!
tutorial/tutorial_okidomew_text_003_01:
Custom items can be obtained as
rewards from Mission Bingo.
tutorial/tutorial_okidomew_text_003_02:
The missions can be completed by
progressing through the main story.
tutorial/tutorial_okidomew_text_003_03:
The vouchers obtained from these
missions can be exchanged in
Exchange Items to raise the sync
pair’s move level.
tutorial/tutorial_okidomew_text_003_04:
Complete missions to strengthen
Professor Oak & Mew!
tutorial/tutorial_timeattack_01:
This is a time trial event.
The goal is to win battles in
the shortest time possible.
tutorial/tutorial_timeattack_02:
The grade you achieve is based on
your completion time. The higher the
grade, the more points you receive!
tutorial/tutorial_timeattack_03:
Multiple rewards are available based
on how many total points you earn.
You can aim to win all of the
rewards during the event period!
tutorial/tutorial_timeattack_04:
Focus on using sync pairs that add to
the team’s strength and provide point
bonuses in order to more efficiently
earn points.
tutorial/tutorial_timeattack_05:
A set number of attempts for time
trials are added each day of the
event. Try to earn as many points
as you can with your number of
available attempts!
tutorial/tutorial_timeattack_06:
These daily attempts can be carried
over to subsequent days of the event.
Use your attempts whenever you like
during the event period.
tutorial/tutorial_timeattack_exhibition_:
Practice matches won’t award points
toward your cumulative total, but
you can attempt these matches as
many times as you like with no limit.

You can earn medals by beating the
time limit in various missions! Try your
best to complete battles within the
designated times.
tutorial/tutorial_timeattack_target_01:
The time limits for each grade can
be found in Area Details. To check
this info during battle, tap the menu
button in the top left of the screen.
tutorial/tutorial_timeattack_target_02:
Your best times for each battle can
be viewed here. Aim for the fastest
times possible!
tutorial/tutorial_denpoke_005_01:
Complete event areas to collect
legendary prize coins!
tutorial/tutorial_denpoke_005_02:
You can use legendary prize coins to
pull from the prize box and
claim rewards.
tutorial/tutorial_forced_potential_text_:
Next, let’s try using a lucky cookie
to learn a lucky skill.

Different types of lucky cookies teach
lucky skills with different effects.
Choose the lucky cookie you would
like to use.

You can check the effects of the
skills that a lucky cookie provides
by pressing and holding the icon
for that lucky cookie.
tutorial/tutorial_villa_recovery_text_00:
Tap here to use Battle Villa
vitality treats and full recoveries.
tutorial/tutorial_ranking_01:
Complete event areas to get
prestige points!
tutorial/tutorial_ranking_02:
Multiple rewards are available based
on how many points you earn. You
can aim to win all of the rewards
during the event period!
tutorial/tutorial_ranking_03:
After earning a certain number of
points, you will be entered into a
ranking with other players. You can
aim to earn lots of prestige points
and climb the ranks!
tutorial/tutorial_champion_battle_elitem:
Turning on master mode will allow
you to take on more difficult battles.

It is also now possible to reset your
completion status and retry battles
on weeks where you have already
entered the Hall of Fame once.

Go ahead and perform a reset to
make it possible to retry battles.

Try tapping the battle to take a look
at how master mode works.

Master mode allows you to turn on
options that give your opponents the
advantage in battle.

Adding options will increase the
points earned from battles. Options
give more points based on how
much of an advantage they provide.

There is a limit to how many points
you can earn in a single battle.

You can receive rewards after
earning a certain amount of points
from battles. Try to get as many
points as you can!

You can turn off master mode here
whenever you like.

Also note that completion rewards
and total point rewards you have
already received cannot be received
again even if you perform a reset.
tutorial/tutorial_champion_battle_region:
The regions you can take on in the
Champion Stadium change at
fixed intervals.

This changes not only the opponents
you will face in battles but also the
medals you can obtain.
tutorial/tutorial_champion_battle_elitem:
Completing a medal will unlock
master mode and allow you to take
on even more difficult battles.

You can check how close you are to
filling in all the pieces of a medal by
tapping the Hall of Fame button.
tutorial/tutorial_champion_battle_hard_o:
Congratulations! You have completed
the Champion Stadium on Normal!

Hard Lv. 1 difficulty and above have
now been unlocked and provide an
even greater challenge.

Battles at Hard Lv. 1 difficulty and
above are separated by region. The
currently available regions change at
set intervals.

Battles at Hard Lv. 1 difficulty and
above change each week and
provide completion rewards every
week as well.
tutorial/tutorial_denpoke_006_01:
You can use legendary prize coins to
pull from the prize box and progress
through the event!
tutorial/tutorial_board_autoconvert_text:
When you do not have sufficient sync
orbs to activate a tile, co-op sync
orbs will be automatically converted
to the necessary number of sync orbs
to activate the tile.

Ten co-op sync orbs convert to one
sync orb.

This auto-convert feature can be
turned off by tapping the button at
the bottom right of the screen.
tutorial/tutorial_battlepoint_text_01:
You can check and receive battle
point tier rewards from this screen.
tutorial/tutorial_battlepoint_text_02:
You can get battle points by
completing certain events
and battles.
tutorial/tutorial_battlepoint_text_03:
You can get awesome rewards and
special sync pairs that can only be
found here!
tutorial/tutorial_battlepoint_text_04:
Tap the button on the top right for
further details.
tutorial/tutorial_battlepoint_text_open_:
Battle point tier rewards
now available!

You can see a list of tier rewards
by tapping this icon.
tutorial/tutorial_region_text_001_01:
These are special battles that give
sync pairs with a certain region
theme, such as “Kanto,” significant
strength bonuses.
tutorial/tutorial_region_text_001_02:
Region rotation battles are available
daily. The region theme that gets the
bonus will rotate after a set period
of time.
tutorial/tutorial_region_text_001_03:
The strength bonus multiplier
increases with the difficulty of the
battle you join. You can see these
multipliers by tapping on the Bonus
icon next to the Go! button.
tutorial/tutorial_region_text_001_04:
Region rotation battles can be
attempted a set number of times
each day regardless of difficulty, so
take on the difficulty level that suits
your team best! The number of
attempts is reset daily.
tutorial/tutorial_region_text_001_05:
You can receive rewards for
collecting battle points every day in
the region rotation battles. Some
rewards can only be found here. Tap
this icon to see a list of rewards.
tutorial/tutorial_dynamax_text_001_01:
Some sync pairs have the ability to
Dynamax once per battle.
tutorial/tutorial_dynamax_text_001_02:
Pressing the Dynamax button during a
battle will allow these sync pairs to
use their max moves.
tutorial/tutorial_dynamax_text_001_03:
Use Dynamax sync pairs to your
advantage during battle! More details
on how to play can be found in Tips.
tutorial/tutorial_teamskill_01:
You can use skill spheres to level
up your theme skills on this screen.
tutorial/tutorial_teamskill_02:
Theme skills activate when you form
a team with two or more sync pairs
that share the same theme.
tutorial/tutorial_mainstory_seconddepart:
Villain arc unlocked!
The events in the villain arc take
place after the conclusion of the
PML arc.

To best enjoy these stories, we
recommend completing the PML arc
before starting the villain arc.

The villain arc will still be available
even if you haven’t completed the
PML arc, so you can choose how to
proceed through the main story.
tutorial/tutorial_SpecialCos_01:
This event includes a main storyline
as well as individual sub-stories that
feature certain sync pairs.
tutorial/tutorial_SpecialCos_02:
The main storyline will be released
in parts as time goes on.
tutorial/tutorial_SpecialCos_03:
You can obtain Story Keys by
completing each part of the
main storyline.
tutorial/tutorial_SpecialCos_04:
You can use a Story Key to unlock
each of the individual sub-stories.
tutorial/tutorial_SpecialCos_05:
You can enjoy the main storyline as
you try to unlock the individual
sub-story for each sync pair in any
order you like!
tutorial/tutorial_PokemasEvent_01:
Happy Pokémon Masters Day!
When playing single-player, you can
get awesome rewards from a
one-time-only battle.
tutorial/tutorial_PokemasEvent_02:
In co-op, you can take on battles to
collect exchangeable items.
Complete up to the specified chapter
of the main story to unlock co-op.
tutorial/tutorial_PokemasEvent_03:
Once you’ve collected enough
exchangeable items, you can
exchange them for other useful
items in the Exchange Items menu.
tutorial/tutorial_denpoke_01:
Legendary Adventures is a
compilation of special stories about
Legendary Pokémon that have
appeared on Pasio.
tutorial/tutorial_denpoke_02:
During these stories, you can team
up with powerful sync pairs with
Legendary Pokémon.
tutorial/tutorial_denpoke_03:
You can exchange the Custom
Vouchers you obtain from battles for
custom items that can strengthen
special sync pairs.
tutorial/tutorial_denpoke_04:
You can complete a variety of set
missions to earn custom medals
for each Legendary Pokémon.
tutorial/tutorial_mainstory_seconddepart:
Villain arc and Legendary
Adventures unlocked!

The events in the villain arc take
place after the conclusion of the
PML arc, as villainous organizations
set their plots into motion on Pasio.

Legendary Adventures is a
compilation of stories in which you
can team up with sync pairs that
have Legendary Pokémon.

To best enjoy these stories, we
recommend completing the PML arc
before starting the villain arc.

The villain arc and Legendary
Adventures will still be available
even if you haven’t completed the
PML arc.
tutorial/tutorial_souryokuready_text_001:
You can take on only one Full-Force
Battle at a time.

If you’d like to take on a Full-Force
Battle of a different difficulty level,
tap the Reset button in the menu.
tutorial/tutorial_jukebox_01:
The jukebox feature allows you to
obtain song keys and listen to a
variety of music used in the game.
tutorial/tutorial_jukebox_02:
You can listen to songs that you’ve
unlocked in the Music Player, and
use items to obtain new song keys
in Unlock Songs.
tutorial/tutorial_jukebox_03:
Song keys are used to unlock songs.
One way to get these song keys is
by raising sync pairs to 6★ EX.
tutorial/tutorial_jukebox_04:
On the battle prep screen, you
can change the battle music for
battles you’ve completed to songs
you’ve unlocked.
tutorial/tutorial_jukebox_05:
Try to collect lots of song keys to
enjoy a variety of music!
tutorial/tutorial_successive_battles_tex:
The Legendary Gauntlet is a special
event that consists of consecutive
battles against Pokémon that appear
in the Legendary Arena. You can
receive rewards according to your
win streak.

You can challenge the Pokémon that
appear in this event in any order you
prefer. You can challenge the same
Pokémon again once you defeat all
the Pokémon.

Sync pairs that have already battled
won’t be able to battle again until
you reset the challenge. If you’re
having trouble winning, try resetting
to start the challenge again.

The Legendary Gauntlet has special
gauntlet rewards that include a
special type of lucky cookie.

Reaching a certain number of wins
in a winning streak will raise your
drop rate level, thus raising your
chances of receiving special
gauntlet rewards.

You can try to increase your winning
streak by strengthening your sync
pairs and trying out different team
combinations. For more details on
how to play, tap the button on the
top right.
tutorial/tutorial_2022NewYear_Event_text:
You can obtain New Year’s Scout
Tickets by completing the battles in
this event.

You can use New Year’s Scout Tickets
in the New Year’s Poké Fair
Ticket Scout.

New Year’s Scout Tickets can be
obtained daily. Remember to
complete daily battles to earn yours!
tutorial/tutorial_championload_text_001_:
Congratulations! You’ve completed
the Champion Stadium on Normal.

The following areas are now
unlocked for even more
challenging battles!
Victory Road
Champion Stadium: Hard Lv. 1

On Hard Lv. 1 difficulty, the challenge
will feature a specific region, which
is rotated periodically.

The Hard Lv. 1 battles and the
rewards you get for completing
them are refreshed weekly.
tutorial/tutorial_championload_text_002_:
The Champion Stadium’s Hard Lv. 1
battles are quite difficult. You may
want to take on Victory Road first.

On Victory Road, you can join Rosa
and Lillie on their journey to learn
more about how to win these
extremely difficult battles.

While you’re exploring this area, you
can get completion rewards, including
lots of gems and sync pair items. You
can see more details by tapping the
Rewards button.

Plus, once you complete the final
battle, you can get a ticket that will
allow you to select one of three
powerhouse sync pairs to team
up with!

Use the special reward items you
can get from Victory Road to
strengthen your team and try taking
on harder battles!
tutorial/tutorial_championload_text_003_:
On Victory Road, you battle using a
set team and special parameters.

In order to win, you should take your
team’s tactics and choice of moves
into consideration.

Before taking on the challenge, you
may want to refer to Battle Tips.

It’s always possible to complete
high-difficulty battles as long as you
implement the right strategies.
Don’t give up as you try to aim for
awesome rewards!
tutorial/tutorial_championload_text_004_:
You can use the scout ticket you
received in the shop’s Ticket Scout.

You can use the rewards you earned
on Victory Road to strengthen your
sync pairs.

Your next challenge awaits at
the Champion Stadium on
Hard Lv. 1 difficulty!
tutorial/tutorial_labo_text_05_ver2:
Once you place an Egg in an
incubator, all you have to do
is wait until it hatches!
tutorial/tutorial_NazotokiMission_001_00:
In this special riddle event,
you can take on missions with
riddle-like hints.
tutorial/tutorial_NazotokiMission_002_00:
Riddle missions will be added daily.
You can get up to 6,000 gems and
60 5★-Guaranteed Scout Tickets as
rewards, so check them out!
